verses.verse: O that<WH5414> thou wert as my brother<WH251>, that sucked<WH3243> the breasts<WH7699> of my mother<WH517>! when I should find<WH4672> thee without<WH2351>, I would kiss<WH5401> thee; yea, I should not be despised<WH936>.

I would lead<WH5090> thee, and bring<WH935> thee into my mother's<WH517> house<WH1004>, who would instruct<WH3925> me: I would cause thee to drink<WH8248> of spiced<WH7544> wine<WH3196> of the juice<WH6071> of my pomegranate<WH7416>.
His left hand<WH8040> should be under my head<WH7218>, and his right hand<WH3225> should embrace<WH2263> me.
I charge<WH7650> you, O daughters<WH1323> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, that ye stir not up<WH5782>, nor awake<WH5782> my love<WH160>, until he please<WH2654>.

Who is this that cometh up<WH5927> from the wilderness<WH4057>, leaning<WH7514> upon her beloved<WH1730>? I raised<WH5782> thee up under the apple tree<WH8598>: there thy mother<WH517> brought thee forth<WH2254>: there she brought thee forth<WH2254> that bare<WH3205> thee.

¶ Set<WH7760> me as a seal<WH2368> upon thine heart<WH3820>, as a seal<WH2368> upon thine arm<WH2220>: for love<WH160> is strong<WH5794> as death<WH4194>; jealousy<WH7068> is cruel<WH7186> as the grave<WH7585>: the coals<WH7565> thereof are coals<WH7565> of fire<WH784>, which hath a most vehement flame<WH7957>.

Many<WH7227> waters<WH4325> cannot<WH3201> quench<WH3518> love<WH160>, neither can the floods<WH5104> drown<WH7857> it: if a man<WH376> would give<WH5414> all the substance<WH1952> of his house<WH1004> for love<WH160>, it would utterly<WH936> be contemned<WH936>.
¶ We have a little<WH6996> sister<WH269>, and she hath no breasts<WH7699>: what shall we do<WH6213> for our sister<WH269> in the day<WH3117> when she shall be spoken for<WH1696>?
If she be a wall<WH2346>, we will build<WH1129> upon her a palace<WH2918> of silver<WH3701>: and if she be a door<WH1817>, we will inclose<WH6696> her with boards<WH3871> of cedar<WH730>.
I am a wall<WH2346>, and my breasts<WH7699> like towers<WH4026>: then was I in his eyes<WH5869> as one that found<WH4672> favour<WH7965>.

Solomon<WH8010> had a vineyard<WH3754> at Baal-hamon<WH1174>; he let out<WH5414> the vineyard<WH3754> unto keepers<WH5201>; every one<WH376> for the fruit<WH6529> thereof was to bring<WH935> a thousand<WH505> pieces of silver<WH3701>.
My vineyard<WH3754>, which is mine, is before<WH6440> me: thou, O Solomon<WH8010>, must have a thousand<WH505>, and those that keep<WH5201> the fruit<WH6529> thereof two hundred<WH3967>.
Thou that dwellest<WH3427> in the gardens<WH1588>, the companions<WH2270> hearken<WH7181> to thy voice<WH6963>: cause me to hear<WH8085> it.
¶ Make haste<WH1272>, my beloved<WH1730>, and be thou like<WH1819> to a roe<WH6643> or to a young<WH6082> hart<WH354> upon the mountains<WH2022> of spices<WH1314>.
